SE450: Using Command Line Tools: OSX: Java/Ant/Junit [6/16]

  • Install the XCode developer tools from your OS installation disc or from http://developer.apple.com/tools/
  • Run /Applications/Utilities/Java/Java Preferences.app and select the most recent versions of the tools.
  • Download Junit
    • Copy junit???.jar to ~/Library/Java (replace ??? with the correct suffix for whatever version you get)
    • Add the following line to ~/.bash_profile: 
      export CLASSPATH=".:$HOME/Library/Java/junit???.jar:$CLASSPATH"
  • To run ant/junit:
    • create a directory (say ~/hw-01)
    • Unzip the files for homework one into the hw-01 directory.
    • Start a Terminal window: using the finder, start Terminal from the Applications/Utilities folder.
    • At the shell prompt move to the correct directory (type cd ~/hw-01)
    • At the shell prompt, run ant (enter ant).
    • You can run ant by entering ant -find in any subdirectory of ~/hw-01.
